tags: oh and Tom Felton was there too but we didn't see him lol
title: FACTS Gent was amazing!
body:
Despite some small organizational issues (seems to happen at every con now) this was a truly amazing day. 

I met @hellomissmabel again, it was so lovely catching up and thank you so much for the cake! Your lady Thor cosplay was so good :)

We saw several great cosplayers, I really wanted to find a good one from The Nun and I’m so happy I did and he wanted to take a pic with me.
We had VIP tickets for the first time ever this year and it was so worth it just to get good seats in the panels.
We saw Jennifer Morrison who was lovely. I cringed so hard when someone in the audience started her question with “I’m a huge Sebastian Stan fan” but thank god the question that followed was polite and just asked how it was to work with him.
(In Jen’s words Sebastian is very smart, very sweet and very generous to work with, she also mentioned it was great seeing him grow in his career, she even mentioned I Tonya.)

The next guest we saw was David Tennant and he was very funny and so down to earth in his panel, he flew in just for one day so we were very lucky to get him in our small country. ( we didn’t do a photo op with him because he was pretty expensive, would have loved to otherwise but had to make some choices there)

The highlight of this con for me: John Barrowman. His special Anything goes panel was so fucking entertaining and funny. He asks fans on stage, he jokes, he swears, he sings but he’s also genuinely kind to fans. (when there was a technical difficulty during his photo op he came out and just mingled with fans while we all waited)
We had a bit of a risky pose we wanted to do with him that involved grabbing his ass and hubby politely asked if it was okay if he really grabbed it or just play pretend. John just took hubby’s hand and firmly put it on his ass saying yes grab it, grab it! lol
So yeah, I grabbed John Barrowman’s ass today and that’s probably a moment I won’t forget anytime soon.

Now the countdown to the next con can start… ;)

(if you guys wanna see pics they’re all on my IG)

blog.name: audaie
blog.description: DoctorxMaster

summary: David Tennant has helped me through years of bullying, depression, social anxiety and lonelieness, he helped me through a time...
body:
David Tennant has helped me through years of bullying, depression, social anxiety and lonelieness, he helped me through a time when I had to leave my parent’s house without any security or job, he helped me through the death of my father, he’s helping me through hell I’m currently going through.

Today I met him and he looked at me with the warmest and most welcome smile. Today he told me that I looked great. He hugged me and he took pictures with me and my boyfriend, who I only even met through him. He did a fantastic panel and made me laugh, and nod amd squee and cry.

I’m never going to regret anything less than the day I found this amazing human being and my heart decided to just keep him inside forever. He’s my happy place.

Thanks, that’s all. I’m a bit emotional and currently very glad I just have 8 followers. :’D

blog.name: whovianfloozy
blog.title: The Whovian Floozy
blog.description:
My fandom name is Beachy, and this is a multi-fandom blog. 
I'm also a multi-shipper. It's likely I do not sail your ship, but I don't wank and expect visitors to play nicely as well. That includes not adding hate or negativity to my posts, altering them to suit your own ships, or removing my original comments. If you do, you will be blocked.
IRL they call me Doctor. Yep, I'm that old. Sometimes I write things that other people watch. It's all good! I like mocha latte with bourbon. A lot.

summary: Behind the Scenes of Army of Ghosts/Doomsday (Part 9) Excerpts from Doctor Who: The Inside Story:  “We specifically designed the...
caption:
Behind the Scenes of Army of Ghosts/Doomsday (Part 9)

Excerpts from Doctor Who: The Inside Story:

“We specifically designed the Dalek in the first series in relation to Billie’s height,” explains production designer Edward Thomas. “When Billie looks at the Dalek they are eye-to-eye, which is why the Dalek ended up being slightly taller than it had been in the classic series.  In Doomsday, we have the same thing except, this time, Rose is in charge, and against a black Dalek.

“The parallel worlds story was domestic, and therefore a much more real story,” Russell [T Davies] suggests. “Although it involved a sci-fi parallel world, it’s actually about a mum and dad and their daughter; about a family brought together by the Doctor across time and space, and across parallel worlds. And so that was how we wrote out Rose: there’s no other way you could do it. She was so fundamental to the series that I was never going to kill her. I had to seal the walls between different universes and say they can never be transgressed. And I had to leave her happy, that’s the only ending that I could possibly have been satisfied with. So I took the whole history, going all the way back to Father’s Day, as a big set-up for the only thing that could separate her from the Doctor. We knew Billie was leaving at the end of Series Two, right from the end of production on Series One; so we could really plan it all in advance.”

David on Army of Ghosts/Doomsday from DWM #375

They were the scripts that were most affecting when I read them, for obvious reasons, but also for kind of televisual history reasons - with the whole Dalek/Cybermen thing. We filmed those episodes in the middle of the run, rather than at the end, so it was all out of sequence, which is just as well, because it was upsetting enough, really, to film those final scenes. If we’d have done them actually at the end of Billie’s time on the show, I think we might have lost the plot.

Other parts of this post: [One] [Two] [Three] [Four] [Five] [Six] [Seven] [Eight]
[ All Behind-the-Scenes posts available here ]
